results.title: Teyana Taylor’s Pivot to Acting: ‘It Was a Real-Life Faith Walk’
results.abstract: After stepping away from recording music, the artist has turned to movies with a lead role in “A Thousand and One.”

multimedia.caption: Teyana Taylor didn’t yet land her role in “A Thousand and One” before retiring from music, she said, “so it was a real-life faith walk.”
multimedia.copyright: Erik Carter for The New York Times

results.title: Why Tetris Consumed Your Brain
results.abstract: Tetris exploded in popularity after a race in the 1980s to secure global rights for the Soviet-made video game, a tale retold in a new movie. It is still captivating minds decades later.

results.title: Three Great Documentaries to Stream
results.abstract: This month’s picks include a film about a summer camp for the disabled, a portrait of a defense secretary’s regrets about the Vietnam War and one of the best sport documentaries of all time.

multimedia.caption: Arthur Agee in “Hoop Dreams.”
Arthur Agee in “Hoop Dreams.”
Arthur Agee in “Hoop Dreams.”

results.title: How Cold War Politics Destroyed One of the Most Popular Bands in America
results.abstract: A new documentary chronicles the strange, intrigue-filled saga of Blood, Sweat & Tears and its disastrous Eastern Bloc tour in 1970.
des_facet: What the Hell Happened to Blood, Sweat & Tears? (Movie)

multimedia.caption: A planned movie of the tour fell apart as did a proposed TV special. The footage, smuggled out of the Eastern Bloc, was found in a vault.
A planned movie of the tour fell apart as did a proposed TV special. The footage, smuggled out of the Eastern Bloc, was found in a vault.
A planned movie of the tour fell apart as did a proposed TV special. The footage, smuggled out of the Eastern Bloc, was found in a vault.

results.title: A Beginner’s Guide to Dungeons & Dragons
results.abstract: The filmmakers behind “Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves” help explain the characters, monsters and spells that make up their new film.

results.title: Adam Sandler Grows Up (Mostly)
results.abstract: At 56, the formerly juvenile funnyman has matured into a subtler, more nuanced comedy performer. It’s why the “Murder Mystery” films work so well.

multimedia.caption: Adam Sandler opposite Jennifer Aniston in “Murder Mystery 2.” Even in comic movies lately, the actor laces his performances with depth.
Adam Sandler opposite Jennifer Aniston in “Murder Mystery 2.” Even in comic movies lately, the actor laces his performances with depth.
Adam Sandler opposite Jennifer Aniston in “Murder Mystery 2.” Even in comic movies lately, the actor laces his performances with depth.

results.abstract: The French director, whose latest film is “Smoking Causes Coughing,” spoke about five comedy clips that have inspired his work.

results.title: ‘A Thousand and One’ Review: A New York Love Story
results.abstract: A mesmerizing Teyana Taylor stars in A.V. Rockwell’s feature directing debut, about motherhood and survival in a fast-changing city.

multimedia.caption: Played by a mesmerizing Teyana Taylor, Inez holds you rapt throughout a sweeping New York story of love and survival, motherhood and gentrification.
Played by a mesmerizing Teyana Taylor, Inez holds you rapt throughout a sweeping New York story of love and survival, motherhood and gentrification.

results.title: Michael Blackwood, Who Captured 20th-Century Artists on Film, Dies at 88
results.abstract: He made cinéma vérité documentaries — more than 160 — about musicians (Thelonious Monk), architects (Frank Gehry), composers (Philip Glass) and sculptors (Isamu Noguchi).

multimedia.caption: Michael Blackwood in 1975. “His priority wasn’t making an art piece,” his son said, “but to make a film about the art his camera was capturing.”
Michael Blackwood in 1975. “His priority wasn’t making an art piece,” his son said, “but to make a film about the art his camera was capturing.”
Michael Blackwood in 1975. “His priority wasn’t making an art piece,” his son said, “but to make a film about the art his camera was capturing.”

results.title: ‘Pretty Baby: Brooke Shields’ Review: Girlhood, Interrupted
results.abstract: Lana Wilson’s documentary blossoms in moments of cultural commentary, where it builds a mood of reminiscence gone rancid.

multimedia.caption: Brooke Shields is the subject of the documentary “Pretty Baby: Brooke Shields.”
Brooke Shields is the subject of the documentary “Pretty Baby: Brooke Shields.”
Brooke Shields is the subject of the documentary “Pretty Baby: Brooke Shields.”

results.title: ‘Hot Ones’ Was a Slow Burn All Along
results.abstract: This YouTube talk show’s premise is simple: Disarm celebrities with deep-cut questions and scorchingly spicy wings. Nearly 300 episodes later, the recipe still works.

multimedia.caption: “We’ve lived through like four different new media generations,” said Sean Evans, the longtime host of “Hot Ones,” “and we’ve been able to ride those rocky waters, but just in like the smoothest way.”
multimedia.copyright: Peter Fisher for The New York Times

results.title: Netflix’s Approach Shifts, Pushing Content That Can ‘Pop’
results.abstract: The streaming service long thought spending on ads didn’t result in more viewers. That has subtly changed under the marketing chief Marian Lee.

results.title: Ryuichi Sakamoto, Oscar-Winning Japanese Composer, Dies at 71
results.abstract: Mr. Sakamoto, whose work with Yellow Magic Orchestra influenced electronic music, composed scores for “The Last Emperor” and “The Revenant.”

multimedia.caption: The composer Ryuichi Sakamoto in Manhattan in 2018. His music was catchy, emotive and deeply attuned to the sounds around him, and he won an Oscar, a Grammy and two Golden Globes.
multimedia.copyright: Nathan Bajar for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: The composer Ryuichi Sakamoto in Manhattan in 2018. His music was catchy, emotive and deeply attuned to the sounds around him, and he won an Oscar, a Grammy and two Golden Globes.

results.title: Michael R. Jackson on the Soap Opera Origins of ‘White Girl in Danger’
results.abstract: The musical’s creator and creative team discuss their influences, including “Days of Our Lives,” “Showgirls” and D’Angelo.

multimedia.caption: Michael R. Jackson’s new musical satire, “White Girl in Danger,” set in a soap opera town called Allwhite, is in previews at Second Stage’s Tony Kiser Theater.

results.title: A Movie Confronts Germany’s Other Genocide
results.abstract: “Measures of Men” tells the story of the systematic massacre of Herero and Nama people in what is now Namibia. Its maker hopes the film will bring a debate about Germany’s colonial guilt into the center of society.
des_facet: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

multimedia.caption: Leonard Scheicher, left, and Girley Jazama in “Measures of Men,” which tells the story of the Herero and Nama genocide in what now Namibia through the eyes of a German anthropologist.
Leonard Scheicher, left, and Girley Jazama in “Measures of Men,” which tells the story of the Herero and Nama genocide in what now Namibia through the eyes of a German anthropologist.
Leonard Scheicher, left, and Girley Jazama in “Measures of Men,” which tells the story of the Herero and Nama genocide in what now Namibia through the eyes of a German anthropologist.

results.title: ‘Imagining the Indian’ Review: Fighting Offensive Imagery
results.abstract: This documentary, subtitled “The Fight Against Native American Mascoting,” argues that Native-themed sports team branding fits into a history of systemic racism.

results.abstract: This emotionally probing, if occasionally unfocused, drama explores the dynamics among an egocentric mother and her three daughters.

results.title: ‘In Viaggio: The Travels of Pope Francis’ Review: Serene Demeanor, Bracing Message
results.abstract: The Pontiff travels well. Gianfranco Rosi’s new documentary chronicles his visits to Catholic communities the world over, and he never seems to tire.
des_facet: In Viaggio: The Travels of Pope Francis (Movie)

multimedia.caption: In his first nine years as Pope, Francis visited almost 60 countries. Gianfranco Rosi’s documentary features footage shot over those years.

results.title: Prosecutor Behind ‘Rust’ Charges Steps Aside, Appointing Replacements
